text.content:
NURSING NOTE 
    0700 - 1900

    Has there been a FALL in the past 48 hours? 
         No

P: pain, infection
I: Antibiotics, labs as ordered
E: improving

PROBLEM LIST AND GOALS
~~~~ 
PAIN
~~~~
      PROBLEM or Need:  PAIN (Pain scale > 4, or patient requests 
intervention)
Goal: Pain scale scale < 4, or patient reports acceptable pain level.
Target date: Within 72 hours of admission. 

                 Problem status:  IN PROGRESS
   INTERVENTIONS
   Pain Management (NIC #1400)
   Definition: Alleviation of pain or a reduction in pain to a level of 
comfort
   that is acceptable to the patient.
   Patient uses distraction.
   Assess comfort needs q 4 hours. 
   If pain continues at greater than or equal to 4, complete Basic Pain
   Assessment/Reassessment(WILDCATS).
   Control environmental factors that may influence patient's response to 
   discomfort.
        lights dimmed, door closed due to noise in 
     hallway
   Reduce or eliminate factors that are barriers to pain management.
   Fear, Knowledge devicit
    Provide/teach information on pain management strategies
   Patient given copy of the leaflet, "Managing Your Pain": Yes
   Family member given copy of the leaflet, "Managing Your Pain": 
   EVALUATION: 
pt reports pain improvement

IV ACCESS
   Peripheral IV 
     Size:20
     Location:R hand 
     Date placed:May 30,2012

0800 assessment completed.  pt awake, alert, call light in reach.  "Feeling 
better"
0824 - MD at bedside, review labs, I+O's and vital signs.  Plan - continue 
Abx, ambulate, diet.

0900 am meds, oob to chair with minimal assist

1100 pt independant with ADL's

1200 pt requesting lunch.  called to Dr. Provider to remind about diet order. 
crackers and jello obtained for the patient.

1600 pt returned to bed independantly.  Pt remains febrile.

1700 oob to chair with minimal assist

1800 pt recieved late tray, tolerating dinner well.

1900 - report to night shift RN.
text.author: NURSE,TWENTY-EIGHT
